title: 1995년 In Re Michael Ben Graves 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: In Re Michael Ben Graves. 판결일: 1995-12-14. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: In Re Michael Ben GRAVES
**판결일**: 1995-12-14
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Michel, Nies, Rich

## 변호인

Michael B. Graves, Los Angeles, California, submitted pro se., Nancy J. Linck, Solicitor, Office of the Solicitor, of Arlington, Virginia, submitted for respondent. With her on the brief were Albin F. Drost, Deputy Solicitor, James T. Carmichael and Joseph G. Piccolo, Associate Solicitor.

## 인용

- 69 F.3d 1147

## 판결문 요약

69 F.3d 1147
    36 U.S.P.Q.2d 1697
    In re Michael Ben GRAVES.
    No. 95-1199.
    United States Court of Appeals,Federal Circuit.
    Nov. 9, 1995.Rehearing Denied;  Suggestion for Rehearing In Banc DeclinedDec. 14, 1995.
    
      Michael B. Graves, Los Angeles, California, submitted pro se.
      Nancy J. Linck, Solicitor, Office of the Solicitor, of Arlington, Virginia, submitted for respondent.  With her on the brief were Albin F. Drost, Deputy Solicitor, James T. Carmichael and Joseph G. Piccolo, Associate Solicitor.
      Before RICH, Circuit Judge, MICHEL, Circuit Judge, and NIES, Senior Circuit Judge.*
      RICH, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      Michael Ben Graves (applicant) appeals from the 30 September 1994 and the 20 January 1995 decisions of the United States Patent and Trademark Office Board of Patent Appeals and Interferences (Board) (Appeal No. 93-4456).  In its 20 January decision, the Board denied the applicant's request that the Board change its 30 September decision.  In its 30 September decision, the Board affirmed the examiner's final rejection of claims 4-6 of application Serial No. 07/870,452, entitled "Power Interconnect Tester."   The Board affirmed the rejection of claims 4 and 6 under 35 U.S.C. Sec. 102(b) as being anticipated by Rockwell et al., U.S. Patent No. 4,399,400 (Rockwell), and affirmed the rejection of claim 5 under section 102(b) as being anticipated by Coben, U.S. Patent No. 4,814,693 (Coben).  We affirm.
    
    BACKGROU...
